value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">2</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Anon.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">common voice singing out of doors. he has no house. He lives</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">a roaming life, crossing the fields, 
            <choice>
              <sic>moutning</sic>
              <corr>mounting</corr>
            </choice> the hills,</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">and lying down by the hawthown to listen to 
            <choice>
              <sic>te</sic>
              <corr>the</corr>
            </choice> nightingale.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Still, by shutting out a 
            <choice>
              <sic>chimey</sic>
              <corr>chimney</corr>
            </choice> or a bungalow</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">we can see what <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#anon" key="Anon">Anon</rs> saw-- the bird haunted reed whispering</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">fen, the down, and the green scar never healed along which</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">he came when he made his journeys. He was a 
            <choice>
              <sic>simp le</sic>
              <corr>simple</corr>
            </choice> singer,</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">lifting a song or a story from other peoples lips, and 
            <choice>
              <sic>lettig</sic>
              <corr>letting</corr>
            </choice></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the 
            <choice>
              <sic>auience</sic>
              <corr>audience</corr>
            </choice> join in the 
            <choice>
              <sic>chours</sic>
              <corr>chorus</corr>
            </choice>. Sometimes he made a few</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">lines that exactly 
            <choice>
              <sic>matchedhis</sic>
              <corr>matched his</corr>
            </choice> 
            <choice>
              <sic>emtoin</sic>
              <corr>emotion</corr>
            </choice>--he was an 
            <choice>
              <sic>arist</sic>
              <corr>artist</corr>
            </choice>.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"> <!-- find a way to render blank lines --></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"> </l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"> </l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"> </l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"> </l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">But there is no name to that song.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">When at last the house was built, he 
            <choice>
              <sic>song</sic>
              <corr>sung</corr>
            </choice> only at  the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">back door.  Upstairs they spoke French; his song was sung</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">in English; and the words were so uncouth</l>

<quote xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" source="#" rend="block">
            <l>Icham for woing al forwake</l>
            <l>Wery no water in wore</l>
          </quote>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">that they 
            <choice>
              <sic>n ed</sic>
              <corr>need</corr>
            </choice> a 
            <choice>
              <sic>ditioc nary</sic>
              <corr>dictionary</corr>
            </choice> now.</l>]

<quote xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" source="#" rend="block">
            <l>Icham for woing al forwake</l>
            <l>Wery no water in wore</l>
          </quote>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <choice>
              <sic>Bu </sic>
              <corr>But</corr>
            </choice> to the listener then, to <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations/.xml#psn-whar">Harrison</rs> for 
            <choice>
              <sic> xample</sic>
              <corr>example</corr>
            </choice> in his</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <choice>
              <sic>pasronage</sic>
              <corr>parsonage</corr>
            </choice>, they were not only difficult. They were painful.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">They reminded him of his lack of intellectual [illeg.]</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">His intellectual pedigree reached 
            <choice>
              <sic>vack</sic>
              <corr>back</corr>
            </choice> only to <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-jgow" key="Gower, John">Gower</rs></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-wlan" key="Langland, William">Langland</rs>, <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-gcha" key="Chaucer, Geoffrey">Chaucer</rs>, a bare 
            <choice>
              <sic>hundre</sic>
              <corr>hundred</corr>
            </choice> and fifty years.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">To have 
            <choice>
              <sic>anscestors</sic>
              <corr>ancestors</corr>
            </choice> he must 
            <choice>
              <sic>ross</sic>
              <corr>cross</corr>
            </choice> the <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-chan" key="Channel, The">channel</rs>. His ancestors</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">by way of the mind are Greeks and 
            <choice>
              <sic>Rla ns</sic>
              <corr>Romans</corr>
            </choice>. His page is</l>
